Package br.com.kirgh.app.services

Class AddressService

java.lang.Object
br.com.kirgh.app.services.AddressService
@Service public class AddressService extends Object
The AddressService class creates and saves a new address to the database, along with its relation to a parent user, and returns a response with the new address's ID and a success message.

  • Method Details

    • createAddress

      @Transactional public Address createAddress(AddressDTO addressDTO)
      This function creates a new address and saves it to the database, while also checking if the parent user exists and if the address already exists for that user.
      Parameters:
      addressDTO - An object of type AddressDTO that contains the information needed to create a new address.
      Returns:
      The method is returning an instance of the Address class.

    • getAddresses

      @Transactional(readOnly=true) public org.springframework.data.domain.Page<Address> getAddresses(org.springframework.data.domain.Pageable pageable)
      This function retrieves a page of addresses from the address repository in a read-only transaction.
      Parameters:
      pageable - The pageable parameter is an object of type Pageable which represents the pagination information for the query. It contains details such as the page number, page size, sorting criteria, etc.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a Page object containing a list of Address entities.

    • getFilteredAddresses

      @Transactional(readOnly=true) public org.springframework.data.domain.Page<Address> getFilteredAddresses(Map<String,String> filters, org.springframework.data.domain.Pageable pageable)
      The function retrieves filtered addresses based on the provided filters and pageable information.
      Parameters:
      filters - A map containing the filters to be applied to the addresses. The keys of the map represent the field names of the Address entity, and the values represent the filter values for those fields.
      pageable - The pageable parameter is used to specify the pagination settings for the query. It includes information such as the page number, page size, and sorting criteria. This allows the method to return a specific page of results instead of retrieving all addresses at once.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a Page object containing a list of Address entities that match the specified filters and are paginated according to the provided Pageable object.

    • getAllAddressInfoById

      @Transactional(readOnly=true) public Address getAllAddressInfoById(UUID id)
      The function retrieves address information by its ID from the address repository, throwing an exception if the address is not found.
      Parameters:
      id - The id parameter is of type UUID and represents the unique identifier of the address that we want to retrieve information for.
      Returns:
      The method is returning an instance of the Address class.

    • getAllAppliancesBoundAddress

      @Transactional(readOnly=true) public AddressCompleteInfoDTO getAllAppliancesBoundAddress(UUID id)
      This function retrieves an address and a list of appliances associated with that address, and returns them as a DTO object.
      Parameters:
      id - The parameter id is of type UUID and represents the unique identifier of an address.
      Returns:
      The method is returning an instance of the AddressCompleteInfoDTO class.

    • updateAddressInfoById

      @Transactional public Address updateAddressInfoById(UUID id, AddressUpdateDTO addressUpdateDTO)
      The function updates an address by its ID using the information provided in the AddressUpdateDTO object.
      Parameters:
      id - The id parameter is of type UUID and represents the unique identifier of the address to be updated.
      addressUpdateDTO - The addressUpdateDTO parameter is an object of type AddressUpdateDTO. It contains the updated information for an address, such as the street, city, state, postal code, etc.
      Returns:
      The method is returning an instance of the Address class.

    • deleteAddressById

      @Transactional public void deleteAddressById(UUID id)
      This function deletes an address by its ID, along with its related appliances and address relations.
      Parameters:
      id - The id parameter is a UUID (Universally Unique Identifier) that represents the unique identifier of the address to be deleted.
